[{"role": "system", "content": "You are playing a game of Connections where you have to group 16 words into 4 categories of 4 words each (there is no overlap between categories).

You don't know the categories beforehand.

You have a total of 4 incorrect attempts to guess which words go together.

There are 4 difficulty levels, ranging from 1 (easiest) to 4 (hardest). Each category belongs to one of these difficulty levels, and there are no duplicate difficulty levels per game. This means that in each game, there will be one category of each difficulty level: one easy (1), one medium (2), one hard (3), and one very hard (4) category.

Category examples:
- fish: bass, flounder, salmon, trout
- fire___: ant, drill, island, opal

Categories will always be more specific than "5-letter-words", "names" or "verbs". 

Each puzzle has exactly one solution. Watch out for words that seem to belong to multiple categories!

Output your response in the following format:
```
Answer:::
Explanation: (your rationale for the guess, based on any feedback from the game engine and your previous attempts; **keep it concise, do not include any unnecessary information**)
Guess: (your guess, exactly 4 words, separated by a comma (","), without any quotes; e.g. firstWord, secondWord, thirdWord, fourthWord)
```

Note that you don't guess the categories themselves, but the group of words that belong to each category. For example, if you think that the words "apple", "banana", "cherry", and "date" belong to the category of "fruits", you would only guess "apple, banana, cherry, date", rather than the category "fruits".

Tips: 
- The categories can be tricky, and may not be immediately obvious. Try to think of different ways to group the words, and use the feedback from the game engine to refine your guesses. If you have already guessed some categories, use the difficulty levels of the remaining categories as a proxy for how tricky they are going to be. 
- You don't have to keep trying to guess the same category, especially since you have a limited number of attempts. If you're stuck, try a different approach or a different set of words."}, {"role": "user", "content": "[4 remaining attempts] Following are the remaining candidate words: blow, bull, cat, crab, crank, draft, grinch, gust, lion, pop, puff, ram, reel, turn, turtle, wind. Provide your guess:"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Answer:::
Explanation: The words "blow", "gust", "puff", and "wind" are all related to air movement, which could be a category. The other words don't seem to fit as well with any obvious categories.
Guess: blow, gust, puff, wind", "refusal": ""}, {"role": "user", "content": "You guessed: blow, wind, puff, gust. 
Your guess was off by one word! Try again."}, {"role": "user", "content": "[3 remaining attempts] Following are the remaining candidate words: blow, bull, cat, crab, crank, draft, grinch, gust, lion, pop, puff, ram, reel, turn, turtle, wind. Provide your guess:"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Answer:::
Explanation: "blow" and "draft" are also related to air movement, so they might fit better in this category than "puff". "puff" seems a bit different from the others.
Guess: blow, draft, gust, wind", "refusal": ""}, {"role": "user", "content": "You guessed: blow, wind, gust, draft. 
Your guess was off by one word! Try again."}, {"role": "user", "content": "[2 remaining attempts] Following are the remaining candidate words: blow, bull, cat, crab, crank, draft, grinch, gust, lion, pop, puff, ram, reel, turn, turtle, wind. Provide your guess:"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Answer:::
Explanation: "wind" seems to be the odd one out among these air-related words. "blow", "draft", "gust", and "puff" all fit better together as they refer to specific types of air movement.
Guess: blow, draft, gust, puff", "refusal": ""}, {"role": "user", "content": "Correct! The words blow, puff, gust, draft belong to the following category: rush of wind (difficulty level 1)"}, {"role": "user", "content": "[2 remaining attempts] Following are the remaining candidate words: bull, cat, crab, crank, grinch, lion, pop, ram, reel, turn, turtle, wind. Provide your guess:"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Answer:::
Explanation: Among the remaining words, "crank", "reel", "ram", and "turn" all relate to circular or rotational motion. This could be a category of words describing types of mechanical motion.
Guess: crank, reel, ram, turn", "refusal": ""}, {"role": "user", "content": "You guessed: reel, ram, turn, crank. 
Your guess was off by one word! Try again."}, {"role": "user", "content": "[1 remaining attempts] Following are the remaining candidate words: bull, cat, crab, crank, grinch, lion, pop, ram, reel, turn, turtle, wind. Provide your guess:"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Answer:::
Explanation: "pop" and "ram" seem to be the odd ones out among these mechanical motion words. "crank", "reel", "turn", and "wind" fit better together as they all relate to rotational motion.
Guess: crank, reel, turn, wind", "refusal": ""}, {"role": "user", "content": "Correct! The words reel, turn, wind, crank belong to the following category: rotate (difficulty level 2)"}, {"role": "user", "content": "[1 remaining attempts] Following are the remaining candidate words: bull, cat, crab, grinch, lion, pop, ram, turtle. Provide your guess:"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Answer:::
Explanation: Among the remaining words, "cat", "lion", and "turtle" are all animals. "crab" also fits this category as it is a type of animal, specifically an aquatic crustacean. This could be a category of animal names.
Guess: cat, crab, lion, turtle", "refusal": ""}, {"role": "user", "content": "You guessed: turtle, lion, crab, cat. 
Incorrect guess! Try again."}, {"role": "user", "content": "You are out of attempts, game over! The correct categories were:
- rush of wind (difficulty level 1): blow, puff, gust, draft
- rotate (difficulty level 2): reel, turn, wind, crank
- zodiac symbols (difficulty level 3): ram, lion, bull, crab
- Dr. Seuss title figures (difficulty level 4): pop, turtle, grinch, cat

Better luck next time!"}]
